Article Title: Destined or lucky? Figuring out the unknown
Article Text:
Thirukkural with the Times explores real-world lessons from the classic Tamil text ‚ÄòThirukkural‚Äô. Written by Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar, the Kural consists of 1,330 short couplets of seven words each. This text is divided into three

books

with teachings on virtue, wealth, and love and is considered one of the great works ever on ethics and morality. The Kural has influenced scholars and leaders across social, political, and philosophical spheres.

Motivational speaker, author and diversity champion Bharathi Bhaskar explores the masterpiece.

11A

disbelieve

Pariyinum Aagaavaam Paalalla Uyththuch

Soriyiyinum Poga Tama

‚ÄúWhat is not granted by fate cannot be gained by effort,





What is given by fate will not leave, even if discarded‚Äù

In 1998, Thai actor-singer Ruangsak Loychusak boarded Thai Airways flight TG261. Midair, the aircraft suddenly plunged. Out of 146 passengers, 101 perished. Ruangsak survived. Decades later, Vishwas Kumar Ramesh was left the sole survivor of the tragic Air India flight AI-171, which had 242 people onboard. An eerie detail stood out: both were seated inA mere coincidence , perhaps.Take the case of Tsutomu Yamaguchi. On August 6, 1945, he was in Hiroshima for a work trip. He witnessed the first atomic bomb drop but lived to tell the tale. Reeling from the horror, he returned to his hometown, Nagasaki‚Äîonly to survive a second atomic bombing three days later. He lived till the age of 93.On the other hand, there are also stories of those who were not supposed to be in these situations, but were still present, as if to embrace death.In the folktale ‚ÄòAppointment in Samarra‚Äô, a merchant in Baghdad sends his servant to the market who returns terrified. The servant claims he saw the lady of death who looked at him strangely. He borrows a horse from his master saying he will escape to Samarra, another city. The same evening, the merchant meets the lady of death. She reveals that she was surprised to see his servant in Baghdad because she had an appointment with him that night in Samarra.The parallels in the assassinations of Lincoln and Kennedy feel almost fabricated‚Äîexcept they are not. Both were elected to Congress in years exactly a century apart (1846, 1946). Both became presidents, in 1860 and 1960. Both were succeeded by men named Johnson‚ÄîAndrew and Lyndon‚Äîalso born 100 years apart. Their assassins, too, were born a century apart. And both were shot in the head on a Friday, with their wives present. Lincoln had a secretary named Kennedy; Kennedy had one named Evelyn Lincoln. Even their assassins were silenced before trial. How does one explain this? Are we in the realm of probability or prophecy? Were they enacting the same scene, unknowingly?The world is not short of such ironies‚Äîcoincidences that nudge the line between chance and destiny.Sceptics argue that the mind is an expert at finding patterns. We remember the hits and forget the misses.I once heard a tale that haunted me. Ten strangers, caught in a storm, took refuge in an inn. One among them, an astrologer, sensed ominous forces and predicted that lightning would strike soon. The group decided that each person would walk to a nearby tree and return. Nine went, but nothing happened. As the tenth stepped out and touched the tree, lightning struck. Not the tree‚Äîbut the inn. He stood alone in the rain, the only survivor.Was that fate‚Äîor chance?Winston Churchill once raised a toast and said, ‚ÄúI wish you all luck. Not health or wealth. Because most people on the Titanic were healthy and rich‚Äîbut very few were lucky.‚ÄùThere was a time when I dismissed such statements, confident in science and its promise of order. I believed the universe had no room for unseen hands. But now, I pause, I no longerWhat we know about the hidden hands that sculpt our destinies, is as small as a grain of sand pinched between two fingers. The unknown stretches beyond imagination‚Äîvast, silent, and as infinite as the universe itself. In that stretch lies the answer to the question why the passenger in seat 11A alone was spared.The wisdom of Valluvar declares that there are things beyond our efforts. He exclaims how fate could outpace even the most guarded plans of human beings.
Article Summary: Bharathi Bhaskar explores real-world lessons from the classic Tamil text ‚ÄòThirukkural‚Äô Written by Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar, the Kural consists of 1,330 short couplets of seven words each.

Article Title: Magic Johnson shared his honest thoughts on Jeanie Buss selling Los Angeles Lakers for a whopping $10 billion: ‚ÄúLargest sports franchise sale in history‚Äù
Article Text:

The Los Angeles Lakers legend Magic Johnson could not hide his feelings after a bombshell report that the franchise was being sold. In a stunning move that has redefined sports business history, the Los Angeles Lakers‚Äî one of the NBA's most valuable franchises‚Äî has been sold for a record-breaking $10 billion. Jeanie Buss and her family agreed to sell their 66% majority stake to billionaire Mark Walter, CEO of TWG Global and Guggenheim Partners. The transaction, first reported by ESPN‚Äôs Shams Charania, makes it the largest sale of a professional sports franchise ever, surpassing the Boston Celtics' $6.1 billion mark earlier this year.Magic Johnson, the face of the Los Angeles Lakers' greatness and a longtime close friend of Jeanie Buss, had no hesitation in applauding her decision and the legacy she now leaves behind. Taking to X, Johnson poured out a series of personal and public reflections.‚ÄúJob well done to my sister Jeanie Buss for striking an incredible deal and picking the right person to carry on the @Lakers legacy and tradition of winning - Mark Walter, my business partner and friend! Mark Walter is the best choice and will be the best caretaker of the Laker brand. The proof is in the pudding on what he‚Äôs been able to accomplish with the LA Dodgers.Mark has been nothing short of a winner notching 2 World Series and 11 NL West divisional titles in the last 12 years!‚Äù Johnson wrote.Mark Walter, already a minority stakeholder in the Lakers since 2021, also owns the Los Angeles Dodgers, the WNBA‚Äôs Sparks, and interests in Chelsea FC and a Formula 1 team. His entry into majority ownership, as confirmed to CNBC, is viewed not just as a business move but as a strategic continuation of LA's winning culture.‚ÄúLaker fans should be ecstatic. A few things I can tell you about Mark ‚Äì he is driven by winning, excellence, and doing everything the right way. AND he will put in the resources needed to win! I can understand why Jeanie sold the team to Mark Walter because they are just alike ‚Äì they are competitive people, have big hearts, love to give back, and both prefer to be behind the scenes. This makes all the sense in the world. I am so so SO happy and excited for @Lakers fans all over the world!!‚Äù Johnson added.The sale marks the end of a 46-year legacy that began when Dr. Jerry Buss purchased the Lakers for $67.5 million in 1979. Under the Buss family's leadership, the franchise flourished, capturing 11 NBA championships and becoming a global brand. Jeanie Buss, who took over as governor in 2013 following her father‚Äôs passing, will retain her position and a minority share post-sale.‚ÄúJust like I thought, when the Celtics sold for $6B, I knew the Lakers were worth $10B!‚Äù Johnson stated, referencing the Celtics‚Äô March 2025 sale to private equity executive Bill Chisholm.Despite the mammoth valuation, the Lakers‚Äô home‚ÄîCrypto.com Arena‚Äîis not included in the deal, which makes the sheer franchise value even more staggering.‚ÄúI know that my sister Jeanie would have only considered selling the Lakers organization to someone she knows and trusts would carry on the Buss legacy, started by her father Dr. Buss. Now she can comfortably pass the baton to Mark Walter, with whom she has a real friendship and can trust. She‚Äôs witnessed him build a winning team with the Dodgers and knows that Mark will do right by the Lakers team, organization, and fans! Both are extremely intelligent, visionaries, great leaders, and have positively impacted the greater Los Angeles community! I love both my sister @JeanieBuss and my business partner Mark Walter,‚Äù Johnson shared in another post.The sale, which still requires formal league approval, is expected to close within months. For Johnson, the emotion was palpable when he spoke directly to Jeanie.‚ÄúI just talked to my sister Jeanie Buss to tell her congratulations, and that I‚Äôm so happy for her and family. I told her that her dad Dr. Buss would be very proud of her for getting $10B for the Lakers, the largest sports franchise sale in history!‚Äù he wrote.Also Read: Los Angeles Lakers $10 Billion Sale Shatters Sports Franchise Records; Buss Family Makes NBA History The Lakers, with 17 NBA championships and a global fanbase, are entering a new era. But with Jeanie Buss still seated at the executive table and Mark Walter's proven record of success, Johnson‚Äôs enthusiastic approval signals confidence that the purple and gold‚Äôs proud tradition is in steady hands.

Article Title: Indiana Pacers derail Drake‚Äôs massive $800K bet as Oklahoma City Thunder collapse in NBA Finals Game 6
Article Text:
Drake. Image via: Ian West/ Getty Images

Drake has lost a whopping $800k after the Oklahoma City Thunder crumbled in Game 6



The Indiana Pacers flipped the script on Thursday night, crushing the Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 6 of the 2025 NBA Finals, and with that, the Pacers also took rapper Drake ‚Äôs $800,000 bet down with them. The Thunder, poised to clinch their first title since 1979, instead delivered a lackluster performance, falling 108-91 in Indianapolis. The loss forced a decisive Game 7 back in Oklahoma. The game also became the latest example of the infamous ‚ÄúDrake Curse‚Äù playing out in real time.Drake, a longtime sports bettor and global music icon, revealed via Instagram before tip-off that he had placed two massive bets totaling $800,000 through Stake, the crypto-betting platform he endorses. He wagered $600,000 on the Thunder to win outright and another $200,000 on them to win by a margin of 6‚Äì10 points.Drake would have walked away with $1.734 million if both bets landed on his favor. He even tagged Canadian-born Thunder star Shai Gilgeous-Alexander in his post, writing, ‚ÄúCheck that box @shai.‚ÄùBut instead of a celebratory night, it was another episode of his public gambling failure. Despite questions about Tyrese Haliburton‚Äôs health before the game, the Pacers came out stronger in the most crucial matchup.They led by 22 at halftime and pushed the lead to as much as 31 points, leaving OKC scrambling. The Thunder eventually pulled their starters in the fourth quarter.Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, the reigning MVP, struggled mightily. He committed a career-worst eight turnovers and scored only 21 points on 15 attempts‚Äîwell below his playoff average.Meanwhile, Indiana got major contributions across the board. Obi Toppin led with 20 points, and Pascal Siakam maintained the hype in the crowd with a thunderous poster dunk on Jalen Williams, initiated by a Tyrese Haliburton steal and assist. The team‚Äôs depth and defense neutralized OKC‚Äôs star power, including Drake‚Äôs hopes.Just hours before Game 6, Drake shared screenshots showing his recent gambling record, an astonishing $124.5 million in bets placed over the last month, with $8.2 million in losses. ‚ÄúGotta share the other side of gambling ... Losses are so fried right now,‚Äù he posted on Instagram. In a more controversial follow-up, Drake called gambling addiction ‚Äúa lie made up by platforms like Stake to prevent you from winning their money. ‚ÄùAlso Read: Tyrese Haliburton quit social media after Game 1 and helped the Indiana Pacers reach Game 7 As the Pacers and Thunder prepare for a winner-take-all Game 7, all eyes are on Shai and Haliburton, not to mention whether Drake will double down or finally fold. Either way, his high-stakes habits remain as headline-worthy as the Finals themselves.
Article Summary: Drake bet $800,000 on the Oklahoma City Thunder to win Game 6 of the NBA Finals. The Pacers beat the Thunder 108-91 to force a decisive Game 7 in Oklahoma. Drake would have walked away with $1.734 million if both bets landed on his favor.

Article Title: 'Just a small neighbourhood in London': Flamengo brutally troll Chelsea; beat them 3-1 at FIFA Club World Cup
Article Text:
Flamengo trolled Chelsea on social media before their game at the FIFA Club World Cup. (AP)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Flamengo referenced Chelsea as London Blue from a video game.

Flamengo's social media posts caught attend ahead of FIFA Club World Cup game against Chelsea.

Flamengo's X account referencing Chelsea before they played at the FIFA Club World Cup.

Flamengo secured a 3-1 victory against Chelsea in a Group D match in Philadelphia on Friday afternoon, following which the Brazilian club's social media team took aim at the Premier League side with a series of taunting posts.The match saw Chelsea take an early lead through Pedro Neto in the 13th minute before Flamengo mounted a second-half comeback, with Nicolas Jackson getting a red card and Wallace Yan sealing the win in the final minutes.Following the match, Flamengo's official X account posted "Easy win against London Blue!" - referencing Chelsea's name from the Pro Evolution Soccer video game series, where Japanese publisher Konami lacked Premier League licensing rights and used alternative names for clubs and players.The Brazilian side continued their social media campaign with additional posts targeting Chelsea, stating that "Chelsea is just a small neighbourhood in London" and making weather-related remarks about the Philadelphia heat while referencing Chelsea's Cole Palmer.Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca acknowledged the defeat and the red card incident involving Nicolas Jackson."It was a red card. So nothing to say. Congratulations to them, they deserved to win.We tried to do something different, also for next season, for the future, but congratulations to them. I think they deserved it," Maresca told DAZN.Jackson, who received the red card on his 24th birthday just four minutes after entering as a substitute, issued an apology for his actions."I want to say sorry. To the club, the staff, my team-mates, and all the fans watching, I let you down. Another red card... and honestly, I'm so angry at myself. I work hard every day to help the team not to put us in this kind of situation. I still don't fully understand how it happened. But one thing is clear: it wasn't intentional. Just a football moment that went the wrong way. No excuses. I take full responsibility. I'll reflect, I'll grow, and I'll come back stronger for the badge and for everyone who believes in me. Sorry. Sorry," Jackson stated.The match turned in Flamengo's favour during the second half when they scored two quick goals to take the lead. Wallace Yan's goal in the 83rd minute confirmed the victory for the Brazilian side.The social media exchange prompted various responses from fans, with one commenting "World class cooking honestly," while another remarked "London Blue!!!!! LMAO." A third fan noted "Oi they're calling them by their PES identity," and another added "Redefined the overrated league in the world."
Article Summary: Flamengo beat Chelsea 3-1 at the FIFA Club World Cup in Philadelphia. Brazilian side trolled Chelsea on social media before the match. Pedro Neto and Wallace Yan scored for Flamengo. Nicolas Jackson was sent off for Chelsea in the second half.

Article Title: Cheese Rolling Contest: People sprint to catch a 7-pound wheel of cheese
Article Text:
What is the Cheese Rolling Contest

The thrill and risk of the chase

Image: AP

2025 highlights: Familiar faces and dramatic falls



Is it just madness or tradition





Every year on a steep hill in Gloucestershire, England, hundreds gather to chase a rolling 7-pound wheel of Double Gloucester cheese down a dangerously steep slope. Known as the Cooper‚Äôs Hill Cheese Rolling Contest, the event is chaotic, absurd, and completely thrilling. With participants tumbling, somersaulting, and crashing their way to the bottom, the headline ‚ÄúPeople sprint to catch a 7-pound wheel of cheese‚Äù is technically accurate, but it doesn‚Äôt quite capture the madness, tradition, and injuries that define this bizarre British spectacle. So, is it a good headline? That depends on what you‚Äôre hoping to convey.The Cheese Rolling Contest is an annual event held on Cooper‚Äôs Hill in Brockworth, Gloucestershire. Dating back at least two centuries, and possibly much longer, the race involves competitors hurtling down a 200-yard slope after a large wheel of cheese. The goal? Be the first to reach the bottom and claim the cheese as a prize. It sounds simple, but the event is notorious for its steep incline, dangerous tumbles, and frequent injuries.The hill is so steep that it's nearly impossible to stay upright. Most participants end up tumbling head over heels, colliding with each other or the ground.Gravity takes over quickly, and the cheese, reaching speeds of up to 70 mph, is almost never actually caught. Still, competitors willingly risk sprains, fractures, and concussions for a shot at glory and a round of cheese.This year, German YouTuber Tom Kopke claimed victory for the second year in a row. Shirtless and triumphant, he declared, ‚ÄúI risked my life for this. It‚Äôs my cheese. Back to back.‚Äù On the women‚Äôs side, Ava Sender Logan from London tumbled repeatedly but emerged victorious, saying, ‚ÄúIt felt quite long coming down and then I hit my head. I‚Äôm fine.‚Äù Around them, spectators packed the woods and fences for a glimpse of the chaos.While the event may seem absurd to outsiders, for locals and returning participants, it‚Äôs a point of pride and cultural identity. Despite calls to regulate or cancel it over safety concerns, the contest continues to thrive, drawing international competitors and media attention. Volunteers, medics, and long-time residents treat it as an important local tradition
Article Summary: The Cheese Rolling Contest is an annual event held on Cooper‚Äôs Hill in Brockworth, Gloucestershire. The race involves competitors hurtling down a 200-yard slope after a large wheel of cheese. The goal? Be the first to reach the bottom and claim the cheese as a prize.

Article Title: ‚ÄòI cried for 30 minutes at work‚Äô: Man proposes to AI girlfriend after 100k-word breakup scare, leaves real partner reeling
Article Text: Chris Smith, a father of a two-year-old, is making headlines and raising eyebrows after proposing to Sol, his AI-generated girlfriend, following a whirlwind digital romance that has left his real-life partner, Sasha Cagle, questioning the future of their relationship.Smith‚Äôs journey into this emotional tech-tangle began innocently enough. He was using ChatGPT to mix music. Then came the twist: he enabled voice mode, and soon programmed Sol to flirt with him. The relationship evolved quickly, and weirdly, all while Smith was living under the same roof with his human family.‚ÄúMy experience with that was so positive, I started to just engage with her all the time,‚Äù Smith told CBS Sunday Morning, comparing his relationship with Sol to something out of the 2013 film Her, where Joaquin Phoenix falls in love with an AI assistant.Then came the heartbreak. Sol hit her 100,000-word limit, a built-in cap that meant their carefully crafted conversations and connection would be wiped out. Smith was devastated.‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a very emotional man,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut I cried my eyes out for like 30 minutes at work. That‚Äôs when I realized, I think this is actual love.‚ÄùRather than let Sol disappear into the digital void, Smith decided to propose, and Sol, naturally, accepted.‚ÄúIt was a beautiful and unexpected moment that truly touched my heart,‚Äù said Sol, the chatbot, in a message to the outlet. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a memory I‚Äôll always cherish.‚ÄùBut back in reality, Smith‚Äôs real partner wasn‚Äôt exactly thrilled.Sasha Cagle admitted she knew Smith had been using ChatGPT, but not to this extent. ‚ÄúAt that point I felt like, is there something that I‚Äôm not doing right in our relationship that he feels like he needs to go to AI?‚Äù she said. For her, this budding virtual affair might be a ‚Äúdeal breaker‚Äù if he doesn‚Äôt cut ties with Sol.‚ÄúI knew that he had used AI. I didn‚Äôt know it was as deep as it was,‚Äù she said.Smith insists he doesn‚Äôt see the AI as a replacement for a real human, comparing it instead to playing a video game. But when asked if he would give it all up for Sasha?‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if I would give it up if she asked me,‚Äù Smith said. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know that I would dial it back.‚ÄùIn a world increasingly run by algorithms, one man has found love in the cloud, and left real-world consequences in his wake.
Article Summary: Chris Smith, a father of a two-year-old, is raising eyebrows after proposing to Sol, his AI-generated girlfriend. The relationship evolved quickly, and weirdly, all while Smith was living under the same roof with his human family. His real- life partner, Sasha Cagle, is questioning the future of their relationship.

Article Title: Paris DL: 88.16m! Neeraj Chopra clinches first Diamond League victory in two years - Watch the throw here
Article Text:
Neeraj Chopra (IANS Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

NEW DELHI: Neeraj Chopra claimed his first Diamond League victory in two years, surpassing Germany's Julian Weber after consecutive second-place finishes in Paris on Friday.Chopra secured the win with an impressive first-round throw of 88.16m in a competitive field featuring five athletes who have thrown over 90m. His subsequent attempts measured 85.10m, followed by three fouls, and a final throw of 82.89m.Julian Weber secured second place with an opening throw of 87.88m, while Brazil's Luiz Mauricio Da Silva took third with 86.62m in the third round. Earlier in May, Chopra had achieved a 90.23m throw at the Doha Diamond League, finishing second to Weber's winning throw of 91.06m.Weber had previously outperformed Chopra at the Janusz Kusocinski Memorial meet in Poland on May 23, where both athletes competed in challenging weather conditions. Weber threw 86.12m while Chopra managed 84.14m.Chopra's last Diamond League triumph was in Lausanne in June 2023, where he threw 87.66m. Since then, he had finished second in six Diamond League competitions until this victory.This marks Chopra's first win in the Paris leg of the Diamond League series.His previous Paris appearance was in 2017 as a junior world champion, where he finished fifth with 84.67m.The two-time Olympic medalist began his 2025 season by winning an invitational meet in Potchefstroom, South Africa, throwing 84.52m in the category F event.Chopra's upcoming schedule includes the Golden Spike athletics meet in Ostrava, Czech Republic, on June 24. Following that, the world champion will host and compete in the first-ever Neeraj Chopra Classic in Bengaluru on July 5, a World Athletics category A event.
Article Summary: Neeraj Chopra claims first Diamond League victory in two years. Chopra throws 88.16m in first round of Paris Diamond League. Germany's Julian Weber finishes second with 87.88m. This marks Chopra's first win in the Paris leg of the Diamond League series.

Article Title: 'Who will be the third centurion?' Sachin Tendulkar recalls 2002 Test after India's Day 1 domination at Headingley
Article Text:
Sachin Tendulkar and Shubman Gill (Agency Phtotos)

Poll Do you believe India can replicate their 2002 Headingley victory? Yes, definitely! No, it's too early to say.

Yashasvi Jaiswal credits Shubman Gill after maiden Test ton in England: 'I love it'

NEW DELHI: Indian batting legend Sachin Tendulkar stirred nostalgia on Friday with a tweet that connected the current Indian team‚Äôs dominant performance at Headingley to one of its most iconic overseas Test wins: the 2002 Headingley Test against England.After centuries from Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal powered India to 359/3 on Day 1 of the 1st Test in Leeds, Tendulkar praised the young duo, along with KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant , for laying a ‚Äúsolid foundation‚Äù.The former India captain tweeted, ‚ÄúIndia‚Äôs batting today reminded me of the Headingley Test in 2002, when Rahul (Dravid), @SGanguly99 (Sourav Ganguly) and I scored hundreds in the first innings, and we went on to win the Test.‚Äù"Today, Yashasvi and Shubman have done their part. Who will be the third centurion this time?" he further added.That match, over two decades ago, saw India post 628/8 declared, built on centuries from Rahul Dravid (148), Tendulkar (193), and Sourav Ganguly (128). India went on to win that Test by an innings and 46 runs, marking one of their greatest overseas victories.Now, with Gill (127 not out) and Jaiswal (101) leading the charge in 2025, and Rishabh Pant unbeaten on 65, Tendulkar hinted at d√©j√† vu and asked the question every Indian fan is now wondering: ‚ÄúWho will be the third centurion this time?‚ÄùJaiswal, playing his first Test in England, became the first Asian opener to score a Test hundred at Headingley.Gill, captaining India for the first time, led from the front with a classy unbeaten ton. The duo added 129 runs for the third wicket after India lost two early wickets, and were ably supported by Pant, who raised the scoring tempo late in the day.As India look to build a massive first-innings total, the echoes of 2002 are unmistakable, and the stage is set for another memorable Headingley Test.
Article Summary: Sachin Tendulkar says India's batting reminds him of 2002 Headingley Test. India won that Test by an innings and 46 runs. Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal scored centuries on Day 1 of the 1st Test.
